people.name: Fredrik Folke
people.role: Clinical Professor, MD, PhD  Head of Research, Copenhagen Emergency Medical Services, Denmark  Senior Consultant, Department of Cardiology, Herlev Gentofte University Hospital, Denmark
people.org: Copenhagen Emergency Medical Services, Denmark and Herlev Gentofte University Hospital, Denmark
people.research_keywords: Out-of-hospital cardiac arrest (OHCA), resuscitation, in-hospital cardiac arrest, emergency medicine, prehospital triage and treatment
people.offer: ·        Acces to our Danish national Cardiac Arrest Registry since 2001 with more than 85,000 OHCAs.  ·        Reserach experience within post-arrest quality of life studies, registry based and using questionnaires  ·        Qualitative methods with Phd-students running sub-studies  ·        Experience of in-patient cardiac arrest care
people.looking_to_collaborate_on: ·        Multinational cardiac arrest follow-up datasets, survival and quality of life, return to work  ·        Collaboration on long term survival and quality of life for OHCA survivors according to fragility status  ·        Co-designing support pathways for survivors and relatives  ·        Linking acute and long-term cardiac arrest datasets

people.name: Kristin Alm-Kruse
people.org: Norwegian National Centre for Prehospital Emergency Medicine (NAKOS), Division of Prehospital services and the Department of Research and Development, Division of Emergencies and Critical Care. Oslo University Hospital, Norway
people.research_areas: have focused my research on out-of-hospital cardiac arrest (OHCA) patients, with a primary focus lately on rehabilitation and quality of life. My work also encompasses data quality, ECPR, development of health and comorbidities, healthcare use, prodromal symptoms and therapeutic hypothermia.
people.research_keywords: Rehabilitation, quality of life, epidemiology, data quality, ECPR, health development, comorbidities, healthcare use, hypothermia.
